title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" includes definitions. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes related to family farms, security interests, and definitions. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes related to family farms, security interests, and definitions. The amendments involve inserting new language, striking semicolons, and redesignating paragraphs in numerical sequence. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. 

SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''.

SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''.

SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to update the authority of the Trustee, including changes in subsections (b), (c), and (d). Section 328(b) is also amended to limit compensation by removing the ability to serve as an attorney or accountant. Section 328(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to limit compensation for professional services by replacing references to attorneys or accountants with the term "professional person." SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation "on a fixed or percentage fee basis."

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code to specify compensation for officers and debtor's attorney.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code by removing certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS.

Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code by removing certain tax provisions.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION.

Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code by specifying the effect of conversion. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY.

Amends Section 362 of title 11, United States Code by adding provisions related to security interests and changing references from "individual" to "entity." Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions related to the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts and leases, as well as nonmonetary obligations under executory contracts or leases. The amendments to Section 365 of title 11, United States Code include provisions regarding penalty rates in contracts and leases, as well as nonmonetary obligations under executory contracts or leases. The amendments involve changes in subsections (c), (d), and (f)(1) by removing certain paragraphs and modifying others. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item for section 556 in chapter 5 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends Section 503(b)(4) of title 11, United States Code to include subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), (D), or (E) before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes in paragraphs (3)(B) and (7) related to unsecured claims. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Amendments made to Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, include changes in subsection (f)(1)(A)(ii)(II) and subsection (g)(2). Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. In amending Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, provisions are added regarding debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. This includes changes such as inserting specific language and clarifying references in subsections. SEC. 17 amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, US Code, regarding discharge effects. SEC. 18 protects against discriminatory treatment in bankruptcy. SEC. 19 addresses property of the estate. SEC. 19 amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, US Code by inserting "365 or" before "542". SEC. 20 redesignates subsection (g) as subsection (h) in Section 546. SEC. 21 addresses the liability of transferee of avoided transfer. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547. The amendment clarifies the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547 of title 11, United States Code. Section 547(b) is also amended to include reference to section 550(c) for conformity. SEC. 22 amends section 553(b)(1) of title 11, US Code. SEC. 23 modifies section 726(b) by striking "1009,". SEC. 24 amends section 901(a) by inserting "1123(d),". SEC. 25 pertains to the appointment of an elected trustee. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for the election of an eligible, disinterested trustee at a meeting of creditors. The United States trustee must file a report certifying the election, after which the elected trustee will be considered selected and appointed, terminating the service of any trustee appointed under subsection (d). The court will resolve any disputes arising from the election of an eligible, disinterested trustee at a meeting of creditors, terminating the service of any previously appointed trustee. SEC. 26-29 amends various sections of title 11, United States Code, related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. SEC. 29 amends section 1228 of title 11 by changing references from "1222(b)(10)" to "1222(b)(9". SEC. 30 modifies section 1322 by adjusting subsections (b) and (e). SEC. 31 addresses discharge in the bankruptcy code. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, US Code, regarding discharge in bankruptcy cases. It specifies types of debts that are not discharged, including those under section 1322(b)(5), specified in section 523(a)(5), (8), or (9), and for restitution or criminal fines. SEC. 32 amends section 1334(d) of title 28, US Code, regarding bankruptcy cases and proceedings. It clarifies changes made under subsection (c) and this subsection. SEC. 33 amends section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (g). SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, US Code by defining terms related to bankruptcy law and documents. SEC. 35 states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
